comments.body: Maybe these rooms could have something to prevent players building or mining until the room is complete to prevent cheating

Sometimes mobs could spawn in the maze room (put vaults and trail spawners?) for an extra challenge
I think the floatater would be great in Minecraft, but we should be able to craft it, and they should rename it.

Add the Floatator to Minecraft, but craftable only using a material from a new boss.
I love it as well. It's similar to using pistons to make a floating, moving island, but in a more compact, less laggy, and more optimized way.
we could just make it hard to obtain in survival but let's get it added.
YES ADD THE FLOATATER ITS SOOOO AWSOME PLZ ADD IT
I think it should be crafted by a heavy core, surrounded with wind charges and calcium
I think it should be crafted by a heavy core, surrounded with wind charges and calcium in the corners
Perfect for the end. Makes perfect sense
mojang need to add this, it will put a new way to imagine and make great things on the game
I would love to make zeppelins that can cross the ocean in one of my worlds.
seconded
The copper bulb delay needs to be reverted back from two ticks to one tick...

I agree. The copper bulb and crafter were way more interesting with the lower tick dellay, from what i saw ot allowed for some amazing (and fast) contraptions and now for the crafter the contraptions would need to factor in that it can get refilled faster than it can spit out the items, causing some contraptions to possibly break
btw it 0 ticks not 2 the thing is that its been changed to an even tick delay
Good idea!
What about having them turn? They could be like rails, where they default to facing upwards, but if you place another pipe next to it, it would turn to connect with the next pipe.

Another posts suggested this and Iâ€™d like to add it here. The pipes could release a kind of pressure to move entities, like a pressure system to move entities. Entities can be assigned weights if Mojang wants to go the extra mile.
These pipes would be from the Create Mod.
That would be so useful, but I think there should be an iron grate too, and if lava or arrows could pass through it as well it would be great for making so many things.

I don't know if it would be so easy to program a water permeable block like that. But it should definitely be able to be waterlogged, with water flowing out from every side, like a waterlogged top slab.

Agreed, being able to make a walkway through a waterfall without the water being displaced and flowing onto the other grates would look very nice. I would like other blocks to be flowing waterloggable but copper grates is a good start.

The comparator could read what kind of items are passing through the Grate, perhaps mainly by if it's stackable to 1, 16, or 64, is flowing lava versus flowing water, etc

And for the true level of control, maybe the more oxidized the Grate is, the slower items must go to pass through it.
I think it would be cool if projectiles could be shot through the grates too, such as arrows or wind charges.
I know that smoke goes through it, so you can make a smoke wall that you can walk through.

I have a similar idea where you can place a copper grate in a bubble column and the bubbles still pass through. So, if you hook it up to a redstone contraption, you could make an elevator system where you can't pass through it, but the bubble column can without deleting the water source block.
My favorite mod, Better than Adventure, does something almost exactly like this. It's awesome and should be added

Can't be too hard, right? They already have one water-permeable block: AIR. 
Items are entities so I am assuming they mean it shouldn't be permeable to mobs but should be permeable to items. Definitely should also work for bubble columns and water, but I don't know about items. Sure it might have some niche uses but it wouldn't really make sense for like, a sword or block to pass through the grate.
not all
not all
if they redising normal dungeons with normal spawners all gud for me

There are mods that do this, so because Microsoft doesn't want to come anywhere near a lawsuit over stolen Minecraft code, they won't do anything that could possibly seem like they stole code. That means that because modders have done something cool, we can't have it in the base game. If you play Java, who cares? You can just get the mod! If you're like me, and play Bedrock, you will never get updated structures. Mods aren't really an option in Bedrock. So basically, if you want a thing that modders have made, you either have to buy Java, which I don't want to do because I play on Xbox, or you just will have to give up all hopes of ever getting remade old structures, we'll just be stuck with really cool things like, hollow cobblestone cubes that have one mob spawner and a chest.

The old structures have classic designs that cannot be changed, but they could be made bigger and put more rooms inside them to adapt to the new generation of worlds. No todos, algunos estÃ¡n bien tal como estÃ¡n, como las mansiones en los bosques oscuros o los monumentos del ocÃ©ano. Pero sÃ­ a los que se han quedado cortos, como los templos del desierto y la jungla, las mazmorras o la estructura antes del final. I don't see any problem in improving the structures like what the previous comments talk about, there could be the possibility of generating a structure with the old design, but the new ones will be more common, to solve the problem of maintaining the classic design.
what if mojag and new variety aka update but organl is still in the game
Please Mojang
You are completely right.
I want the ostrich and the suricates+the other biome mob

This needs way more votes!!! I waited many, many years for penguins for them to just lose the mob vote! I'm sure other people feel the same way. MOJANG PLEASE!

Just because the majority like one mob doesn't mean nobody likes the others. The system is unfair, especially because content creators can sway the voting if they have enough subs/follows.
Creativity and inspiration trump consistency here, please revert the changes!
This is an amazing idea. It would bring so much life, history and adventure into the game.
This would be very cool, this was actually something I had thought about when they added shipwrecks.
would be cool for the strongholds and the new bookshelves
I think this is a great idea! it would add more life to the game as well as helping beginners!

could add some lore

 

 i love lore

I smell lore. The books can be from an ancient builder of that place and time. Different structures can have different books detailing tiny hints to lore. Emphasis on tiny in order to not give away the whole lore.

Thats a great idea! Maybe they should also be in Strongholds to warn the players about the end, Ancient Cities to explain the Warden and shriekers, and Ruined Portals to help players discover the nether. Maybe even in villages to explain underused features you might not discover on your own.

Add fog, maybe other tree model and higher like jungle trees.

Add dead trees and tree trunk on the ground.
At night parts of the flower could even glow orange in a pattern resembling the eyes of the creaking. To try and trick/scare the players while they are there.

Yes that would be great.

Zombies should also convert to Mossed when Poisoned.
https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/24128250545677-Mossed

And maybe skeletons should turn into strays when in powdered snow
Cool idea. I like it.
This. Sounds. AWESOME.
this is a great idea mine is that they make armor trims for wolf and horses but this is awesome too.
I did also post the idea for armor trims and enchantments for wolf armor in a separate post.
I think that will be better if you will can put it on the already existing armor stands instead of adding new.
I agree. I'm surprised and disappointed that they haven't made horse armor stands by now.
Came here to suggest just this!!
Muy buena idea
Seriously, Mojang. This would make way more sense than feeding Armadillos spider eyes. Let's add two savanna mobs to the update while you still can.
Bees should hate them and chase them away
I think the dark wood forest and the pine taiga would be perfect to the grizzly bear

That would be great!

I think it wouldn't be difficult to develop, the 3D model is the same as the polar bears and pandas, they would just have to develop:

  • New sking for brown bear.
  • Animations; 
  1. Attack: can be the same animation as the polar bear.
  2. Eating: can be the same as the panda but instead of bamboo it eats honeycombs.
  3. Stealing honey: stand up and stick your head inside a beehive, the same as the sniffer does when he buries his head in search of seeds.
  • There may also be a small chance of encountering a brown bear with a honey-stained mouth, like the low probability of encountering sick pandas with runny noses.
They need to change the old sound to be quiet

Not a fan of your off the walls proposal, but I definitely agree the sound needs a rework. It sounds okay when it's a single piston but as soon as it's multiple pistons, it sounds really bad and somehow it sounds wet.

I do think it's fine to keep the old sound effect and just lower the volume and range.

The sound effects have been the same for over 12 years since it was implemented, I think it should be considered an classic and shouldn't be changed, or at least, the new sound should have similar style/characteristics to the old one.

Same reason why the design of the new Diamond Ore texture looks pretty much the same as the old texture. Because it's iconic.

The sound of old pistons is used as one of the gimmicks.
The new piston is no longer a gimmick. The silent piston itself is a wonderful thing, so I would like it to be crafted as a separate item by combining it with carpets, wool, etc.
I'm not a fan at all of the new piston sounds, it sounds wet and ploppy. Personally I've never had a problem with the old sound, but maybe something more like a smooth sliding stone would be better.
The new piston sound makes me think of honey blocks, not anything mechanical. So yeah, while quieter, it's actually worse.

I really appreciate the honest discussion!
I agree, the new sound feels too weak.
the Heavy Piston idea is a bit out there but it has potential.

I like this
old sound was perfect, maybe too loud, but I think I like how clunky it sounds when its loud

Unpopular opinion but, simply making the old sound quieter wouldn't have been it tbh. The sound of the friction is too loud proportionally to the ending 'thump'. Also I could see the current iteration fitting well for a more lightweight, or 'quiet' version of the piston, used in secret doorways, with its own crafting recipie.

With that being said, the new sound still requires further tweaking, as it lacks the frictional sound as well as the weight of the 'thump' being lackluster. Readding the frictional sound at half effect of the old one, as well as making the end thump feel more 'weighty' would suffice.

I agree that simply lowering the volume of the old sound wouldn't work without at least SOME retooling.
I think the new sound isn't actually that bad, it just need a couple of changes:
-Make the end of the sound have more of a harder "Thud" rather than the current one's more wet "Thump" sound.
-I can still hear a bit of the old "shove" sound from the old Pistons in the new sound; make that slightly louder so it's actually present and not an afterthought.

Also, having the old sound as part of the "developer textures" pack would be nice :)
Brilliant idea! More uses for copper!
That would be too similar to the copper bulb.
Maybe with a new texture to differentiate it from the current lanturns

I think they generally should update the lanterns.

they should be crafted from nuggets (iron and copper) and a candle so they can be lit and unlit

I fee the copper bulb is more like the redstone lamp than the lantern. I like the idea of another lantern that is always lit, but with a differnt design not just a different color. Maybe have the recipe include a glass pane so you could change the color output of the light with stained panes.??
They could help guide you to the buried trails in forests when you need to get suspicious sand/gravel or just want to loot them! Like dolphins leading you to ocean ruins or buried treasure!
this could be cool

Would be a great way to add tracking and hunting abilities to wolves. Have the wolf sniff a particular block to find a structure, or a particular kind of raw meat to find an animal. Kind of conflicts with the concept of Sniffers though, since it's in their name and they already search for underground plant seeds.
I think this is a new speedrun method, where players use their well-behaved dogs to quickly complete Minecraft.
Neither are "Ruined" (Bulb is still a 1 block T-flop) but Bulb should definitely get its old thing back
would be fun to swing around with it

This was considered at one point, as an early game alternative to the elytra. I think this would be cool, but it definitely shouldn't be very durable, because copper is so plentiful so stuff should break.
Yes it would be awesome to have this
Genial ðŸ˜„
I agree whole heartedly with this and think it might even be a good idea to make so that you can put unbreaking on the wolf armor so that it doesn't break as quick.

This is a great idea, I like that you mentioned this, because it not only makes bundles more useful but also makes using bows/crossbows a lot nicer to do, instead of swapping arrows, you just put all the arrows you can in a bundle to then use as ammo, nice idea.

I like your idea of the bundle basically being a Quiver but with more possibility, and also, the randomized arrows thing is also pretty nice, this'd be really cool to see in the game.

I hope this feature is added into the game, it would be really fun to have.
Plus I'm sure it'd also be useful for storytelling, if arrows can be shot from the bundles, then a lot can probably be done with this.

Anyways, hope you stay creative and have a wonderful day!

This allows player to have a hidden respawn point, which is in itself pretty cool.

I dont see a reason to remove that glitch that was in the game for so many years, furthermore given that it doesn't have any bad consequences. Please bring it back

I agree, having copper grates allow water bubble flow to pass through but not mobs would be a big quality of life improvement for vertical transportation of players, villagers, and other mobs. Players and mobs getting hurt with a magma bubble elevator is a problem.

It would also provide a unique way to keep water from freezing in typical farmland irrigation systems without the dangers of falling in. No more random torches or fires all over your farmland. For a less practical, but still visually pleasing use, one could make a bubbling hot tub this way.
awesome idea, chestplate could have "hangers" like pattern so thet look like the  overalls miners use and the helmet could have a circle in the fore head to resamble mining lanterns
